title: NBC All-American Summer
content:
This was the original font for NBC’s “All-American Summer” campaign (since switched to Avant Garde):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121184407im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/nbcsummer2_4483.png)

 [‹ (x) WOW identity serif face - Cochin {Robert Farrelly}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121184407/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48075 "Go to previous forum topic") [Que? Expanded serif font. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121184407/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48168 "Go to next forum topic")
author: pdxuser

comments.content: This one has me stumped. Looks like a nice typeface, I’ll be interested to see what it is.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121184407im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/aaux-sample_4385.png)
  
 [Aaux Pro Ultra](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121184407/http:/www.typetrust.com/font/aauxpro/weights) is not a perfect match, but has a lot of characteristics in common with the sample. also, various versions – Aaux, Pro, Next, Display etc – are available from different sources, so another cut may come even closer.
Do you know when it was created...?
This year. It was a short-lived logo.
Seriously... _@ mydot: I was just going to say it reminds me of the typefaces that inspired Gotham_ Talking about being retro!
